citation_title: After Chile, What? Second-Round Pension Reforms in Latin America
topics:
Labor Economics

Labor Supply and Demand

Demography and Aging
abstract: The apparent success of Chile's pension reform catalyzed a number of subsequent" reforms in sister Latin American nations, and the  Chilean model' has now captivated the" attention of policymakers and researchers in the OECD as well.  In this paper we identify six" critical elements of old-age pension reform, and examine how these six elements differ across the" Chilean reform, and several other Latin nations that followed in Chile's footsteps.  We" emphasize how these other Latin American nations adopted different mechanisms to restructure" their old-age pension systems, and we highlight available evidence on system performance in" each case.
